column1:
1326|1:26 P.M.|1:26 P.M.
As she walked down Noyes toward campus
column2: past the giant chirping trees and sturdy hundred-year-old homes full of twenty-year-olds
column4: eye-stabbing silver that she hated on game days. The beautiful morning had evolved into a classic midwestern scorcher and there was no relief from any incoming low-pressure front from Minnesota.
